multiple-choice.question: What does A's statement "I don't know whether you know my number" imply?

options.label: A
options.text: B knows A's number for sure

options.label: B
options.text: B might know A's number, but isn't guaranteed to

options.label: C
options.text: B doesn't know A's number

options.label: D
options.text: A knows B's number

multiple-choice.question: What does B's statement "I know your number, and now I know you know my number too" imply?

options.label: A
options.text: B doesn't know A's number

options.label: B
options.text: B might know A's number, but isn't guaranteed to

options.label: C
options.text: B knows A's number and is confident that A knows B's number

options.label: D
options.text: A knows B's number

multiple-choice.question: What is the only scenario where B could know A's number?

options.label: A
options.text: When there's more than one valid way to factor B's number

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: When A's number is prime

options.label: D
options.text: When B's number is prime

options.text: 5 or 6

title: You could have a secret twin (but not the way you think) - Kayla Mandel Sheets

multiple-choice.question: What is chimerism?

options.label: A
options.text: A rare condition where an individual has two genomes present in the tissues of their body.

options.label: B
options.text: A genetic disorder caused by a mutation in a single gene.

options.label: C
options.text: A condition where an individual has a weakened immune system.

options.label: D
options.text: A condition where an individual has a genetic disorder caused by a viral infection.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the Boston woman who discovered that she had a second genome in some tissues and organs?

options.label: A
options.text: Karen Keegan

options.label: B
options.text: Sarah Johnson

options.label: C
options.text: Emily Davis

options.label: D
options.text: Rachel Lee

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the Greek mythological creature that chimerism is named after?

options.label: A
options.text: Chimera

options.label: B
options.text: Hydra

options.label: C
options.text: Minotaur

options.label: D
options.text: Sphinx

multiple-choice.question: How can chimerism occur in individuals?

options.label: A
options.text: Through the exchange of cells between a mother and fetus during pregnancy.

options.label: B
options.text: Through a tissue or organ transplant.

options.label: C
options.text: Between a fetus and a pregnant woman.

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above.

multiple-choice.question: What is the extent of chimerism in individuals?

options.label: A
options.text: It can vary from one organ to another, and even between tissues within an organ.

options.label: B
options.text: It is always visible and can be detected through genetic testing.

options.label: C
options.text: It is always hidden and cannot be detected through genetic testing.

options.label: D
options.text: It is always present in every cell of the body.

multiple-choice.question: Can chimerism occur in fathers?

options.label: A
options.text: Yes, as in the case of a father who was determined to be his baby's biological uncle through ancestry testing.

options.label: B
options.text: No, chimerism only occurs in mothers.

options.label: C
options.text: Yes, but it is very rare.

options.label: D
options.text: No, chimerism only occurs in individuals who have undergone a tissue or organ transplant.

multiple-choice.question: What percentage of a father's sperm can carry a second genome from an embryonic twin?
What is the significance of chimerism in understanding genetics?

options.label: A
options.text: It highlights the complexity of the human genome.

options.label: B
options.text: It shows that genetics is a simple and straightforward field of study.

options.label: C
options.text: It proves that genetics is not relevant to human health.

options.label: D
options.text: It shows that genetics is only relevant to certain individuals.

multiple-choice.question: How many births started out as twin pregnancies?

options.label: A
options.text: 1 in 8

options.label: B
options.text: 1 in 10

options.label: C
options.text: 1 in 20

options.label: D
options.text: 1 in 50

multiple-choice.question: What is the potential impact of chimerism on our understanding of genetics?

options.label: A
options.text: It could lead to the discovery of new genetic disorders.

options.label: B
options.text: It could lead to the development of new treatments for genetic disorders.

options.label: C
options.text: It could lead to a greater understanding of the complexity of the human genome.

options.label: D
options.text: It could lead to a decrease in the number of genetic disorders.

options.text: A measure of plant stress

options.label: B
options.text: A measure of photosynthetic activity

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: By tracking changes in plant growth rate

options.label: C
options.text: By tracking drops in photosynthetic activity

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: It is more expensive

options.label: B
options.text: It is less accurate

options.label: C
options.text: It can detect drops in photosynthetic activity before visible signs of plant stress

options.label: D
options.text: It is more time-consuming

options.label: A
options.text: It can help monitor the health of individual plants

options.label: B
options.text: It can help monitor the health of ecosystems worldwide

options.label: C
options.text: It can help monitor the effects of environmental changes

options.label: D
options.text: It can help monitor the effects of human activities

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: It can help monitor the effects of human activities

options.label: A
